item.name: Admin Auth Endpoints
item.description:
APIs for managing Authentication for admins
it contains the following endpoints:
- Register Admin
- Login Admin
- Logout Admin

request.description: This endpoint lets you create an admin.
This endpoint lets you login an admin.
This endpoint lets you logout for an admin.

item.name: Agent Management
item.description:
APIs for managing Everything concerning agents

right now i have boken them into subgroups, i.e for admins, for agents etc
it contains the following endpoints:
- Get all agents and their properties
- Get one agent
- Create Agent
- Update Agent
- Delete Agent
- Start Agent Verification
- Verify Agent
- Upload Agent Verification Document
- Get Agent Properties
- Get Unverified Agents
- Get Verified Agents
- Get Rejected Agents

request.description:
this route basically generates an 11 digit alpha numeric code and is sent as a prt of the request
it is stored in the db, and can be displayed on the frontend along with further verification isntructions
i.e a picture of head and torso holding a paper with your full name and your verification code written on a sheet of paper

this takes a file and upload to cloudinary
hope it works

item.name: Admin Agent Management
item.description:
These endpoints are available to admins only to manage agents 

this is an endpoint to get agents properties
it's a bit redundant and I might remove it, since the get all agents endpoint already returns the properties
i'm lazy to do that now

this is an endpoint to get all unverified agents

it takes in the agent id

item.name: Careers management (JOBS)
item.description:
APIs for uploading and managing careers
it contains the following endpoints:
- Create Job
- Get one Job
- Get all jobs
- Delete Job
- Update Job
- Search Jobs
- Toggle job on or off
- Get deleted jobs
- Restore job
- Destroy job(Permanent Delete)

query.description: The search term, the search is done on the title of the job by default,

The column to search on. Optional. default: title
if you have other columns that you want to search on, you can add them as query parameters
allowed columns are: title, location, type
if using the type query key, the allowed values are: 'full-time','part-time','contract', 'internship'

request.description: this endpoint supports both put and patch requests
this endpoint supports both put and patch requests
this endpoint is to permanently delete a career

this endpoint takes the id of the career intended to be restored
you can get the id from the data restored from the get-deleted endpoint
this endpoint returns all the careers that have been soft deleted

item.name: Toggle a career on or off
This route will return the authenticated user information.

request.description:
The login end point only returns a token, so after logging in,
make a call to this endpoint to get the user details/object
then you can store both the token and user details in local storage or however you wish to.

item.name:
Publicly Available Endpoints
Display all properties
item.description: These endpoints are available to all users

query.description: The column to sort by. Optional. default: created_at

The direction to sort. default: asc, options: asc, desc

the following query parameters can be used to filter the results. you can either combine, i guess, or just use one
it takes key value pairs, the key is the column name and the value is the operator to filter by
accepted operators are eq, gt, gte, lt, lte
The price to filter by. Optional.
The city to filter by. Optional.
The property type to filter by. Optional. takes either: 'apartment', 'house', 'shortlet', 'penthouse', 'land', 'commercial'
The status to filter by. Optional. takes either: 'available', 'sold', 'unavailable'
The listing type to filter by. Optional. takes either: 'sale', 'rent'
The number of bedrooms to filter by. Optional.

item.name: Publicly Available Endpoints
item.description: These endpoints are available to all users

query.description: The search term, the search is done on the title of the property,

The column to search on. Optional. default: title
if you have other columns that you want to search on, you can add them as query parameters
allowed columns are: title, name, location, description

agent only endpoints
Endpoint to create a property

This endpoint lets an agent create a property
this endpoint handles only property creation
there is a separate endpoint to upload media for properties
however, be rest assured, so far the authenticated agent is the owner of the property, 
the media will be linked to the property

item.name: User Inquiries management
item.description:
APIs for managing the user inquiries
it contains the following endpoints:
- Create Inquiry
- Get one Inquiry
- Get all inquiries for a user
- Get all inquiries
- Update Inquiry
- Delete Inquiry

item.name: create a new inquiry for a property.

request.description:
so, the inquiry takes a couple fields, and one of the fields are appointment_date
appointment date takes date time, but it is optional.
so, to create inquiries with an appointment, you can add in the appointment date
if you want, I can add in an endpoint for the agent to get only inquiries with appointment dates to provide a way to view the appointments

item.name: Get all inquiries for a user

request.description: well, the user can get all their inquiries

item.name:
Display all the inquries
this is an admin only endpoint btw

request.description: still an admin only endpoint
only the user is allowed to update the inquiry
only the user is allowed to update the inquiry

- Email Verification for User
- Password Reset for User
